title: US, Syrian soldiers injured as joint patrol in ancient city shot at: state media
description: Several Syrian and American soldiers were wounded when shots were fired at a joint military delegation in the ancient city of Palmyra in central Syria on Saturday, state media said.The incident is the first of its kind to be reported since Islamist-led forces overthrew long-time Syrian ruler Bashar al-Assad in December last year, and rekindled the country’s ties with the United States.“Several members of the American forces” were wounded in the shooting alongside “two members of the Syrian...

title: Museum housing ancient Libyan treasures reopens for the first time since Gadhafi was toppled
description: Tripoli's Red Castle museum has reopened for the first time since the 2011 uprising that toppled Moammar Gadhafi, unveiling a trove of treasures that span millennia, from ancient mummies to relics of Libya's turbulent and fascinating history.

title: Twins were the norm for our ancient primate ancestors − one baby at a time had evolutionary advantages
description: Twins are pretty rare, accounting for just 3% of births in the US these days. But new research shows that for primates 60 million years ago, giving birth to twins was the norm.

title: Alien Tech or Ancient Genius? The 1,500-Year Mystery of Ellora Caves | EP 11 | Times Mantra
description: The Ellora Caves are among the most astonishing architectural wonders of ancient India, carved from a single rock mass over 1,500 years ago. At its center stands the Kailash Temple, created using the extraordinary top-down carving technique that still puzzles historians and engineers. Despite the absence of modern machinery, the precision, scale, and symmetry achieved remain unmatched. While many hail it as the peak of human craftsmanship, others believe it raises questions beyond conventional understanding. This explainer delves into history, science, and the enduring mysteries surrounding Ellora’s construction. Times Mantra explores how this timeless marvel continues to challenge what we think is possible.#timesmantra #elloracaves #kailashtemple #ancientmysteries #indiansheritage #rockcutarchitecture #historymeetsmystery #unsolvedsecrets #ancientengineering #indianwonders #elloracave #ellora_art_ #elloraartandcraft #elloracaves #topdowncarvings

title: Ancient soot discovery in Antarctica reveals alarming link to global sea level rise
description: While India is situated approximately 10,000 kilometres away from Antarctica, the consequences of its melting ice are dire for the subcontinent.
